title: Kenosha Officer Won’t Be Charged in Shooting of Jacob Blake
sub_head: District attorney said officer was justified in the Aug. 23 shooting that left Mr. Blake, a Black man, paralyzed from the waist down
body:
KENOSHA, Wis.—The county prosecutor said he won’t bring charges against the police officer who last August shot Jacob Blake, sparking weeks of violent unrest in the small city south of Milwaukee.
Kenosha County District Attorney Michael Graveley also that after conducting a thorough review of the incident he also wouldn’t charge Mr. Blake.
Mr. Graveley said that an independent expert who reviewed the case found that Officer Rusten Sheskey, who is white, had behaved reasonably in the Aug. 23 shooting that left Mr. Blake, a Black man wanted on a felony warrant, paralyzed from the waist down.
The key question, the prosecutor said, is whether Mr. Sheskey had a reasonable suspicion that he or someone else was in danger at the time the shots were fired.
“This has clearly been a tragedy for our community,” Mr. Graveley said, adding that he had to make his decision based on a review of the facts and not be swayed by the politics swirling around the case.
